Key Match Events: The Indian defensive line looked a bit shaky at the moment, as it has allowed the Mauritius forwards to get into the box with authority.
India finally got a shot on target as Manvir Singh went for a shot from a difficult angle and it was saved by the Mauritius goalkeeper.
Chhangte wreaks havoc in the Malaysian box in the initial minute of the second half but the visitors somehow managed to keep the clean sheet.
Pre-Game Insights: Manola Marquez will hope for a memorable start to his national team career with silverware in the city where he began his journey in Indian football.
A new chapter begins in Indian football under a new head coach - Manola Marquez.
India prepare for life after Sunil Chhetri's retirement.
The Intercontinental Cup provides a great dress rehearsal for the bigger task awaiting India in the coming year, the AFC Asian Cup Qualifiers.
Post-Match Reflections: India failed to break the Mauritius deadlock and settled for a goalless draw.
Manola Marquez will take the positives, but there weren't many apart from the clean sheet.
Not an ideal start to Marquez's tenure as they failed to create clear chances and had just one shot on target.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Rain hampered India's training before the match.
Mauritius are currently placed fifth in their six-team FIFA World Cup Qualifiers group in Africa, with four points in as many matches.
Others: Ranked 179th in the world, Mauritius are currently placed fifth in their six-team FIFA World Cup Qualifiers group in Africa, with four points in as many matches.
However, they crashed out in the first round of the Africa Cup of Nations Qualifiers following a 1-3 aggregate loss to Chad in March.
